## Before the workshop

Please make sure you have the following installed:

1.  An [up-to-date installation of R](https://www.r-project.org/)
2.  An [up-to-date version of RStudio](https://posit.co/download/rstudio-desktop/)
3.  The workshop :package: \[mvw\]
4.  The malariaverse :package: \[malariasimulation, foresite, site, netz, cali\]

```{r, eval=FALSE, echo=TRUE}
# For malariasimulation
options(repos = c(
    mrcide = "https://mrc-ide.r-universe.dev",
    CRAN = "https://cloud.r-project.org"))
install.packages("malariasimulation")

# Private packages require network access to the "malaria drive". 
# Contact Pete if you don't have access.
drat::addRepo("malariaverse", "file:\\\\projects.dide.ic.ac.uk/malaria/malariaverse/drat")
install.packages("foresite", type = "source")

# Public packages can be installed directly from github:
remotes::install_github("mrc-ide/site")
remotes::install_github("mrc-ide/netz")
remotes::install_github("mrc-ide/cali")
remotes::install_github("mrc-ide/mvw")
```

Following installation you should be able to successfully run:

```{r, eval=FALSE, echo=TRUE}
output <- malariasimulation::run_simulation(100)
output
```

and

```{r, eval=FALSE, echo=TRUE}
mvw::run_tutorial("Test")
```

If you can't, please contact Pete *before* the workshop.
